Ingredients

  • 2 ounces @UUID[Compendium.brodericks-compendium.plants.0Z1wChZT06d0EyoG]{Psyllium (Plantain Weed)}

  • 3 tablespoon @UUID[Compendium.brodericks-compendium.plants.3CDuKgKTmKQVG7Ze]{Mugwort}

  • 3 tablespoon @UUID[Compendium.brodericks-compendium.plants.VpB0wmdSeJTLZOSB]{Watercress}

  • 1 teaspoon @UUID[Compendium.brodericks-compendium.plants.ZWM9PN4GlimbBoeD]{Viper's Bugloss}

  • 2 teaspoon @UUID[Compendium.brodericks-compendium.plants.Wk7xafQcKyW17bGc]{Thyme}

  • 4 ounces of @UUID[Compendium.brodericks-compendium.plants.tGrjPSpAYjf38s09]{Nettle} leaves

  • 1 teaspoon @UUID[Compendium.brodericks-compendium.plants.h4AvPuHomQoHOJRU]{Fennel} seed

  • 2 ounces @UUID[Compendium.brodericks-compendium.plants.kq3Yzn7pZUQK5Gfn]{Scented Mayweed} flowers

  • 4 ounces pulped @UUID[Compendium.brodericks-compendium.plants.jlkux7HRTqw3RV0G]{Crab-Apple} fruit

  • 8 ounces fresh Water

  • 6 ounces wood ash

  • 1 egg, beaten

  • 1 ounce old Soap

Preparation

  1. Using a mortar and pestle, combine: Psyllium, Mugwort, Watercress, Viper's Bugloss, Thyme, Nettle and Mayweed flowers. Crush to a fine power.

  2. Mix well with the juice of the Crab Apple and the old Soap until everything is blended.

  3. Decant the mixture into a glass jar and seal tightly.

  4. Prepare a paste of Water and Ash. Bring to a boil and add Fennel. Boil until cooked down to a paste consistency .

  5. Wash the wound with a beaten egg.

  6. Pack the wound with the herb mixture.

  7. Apply paste over herb mixture and cover with a cloth.

  8. Every 8 hours the wound should be cleaned and repacked. Rinse the old paste and herb mixture from the skin with clean water. Allow to air for 15 minutes. Re-apply herb mixture and paste as necessary.

system.source: Broderick's Compendium: Plants and Fungi Across the Realm (version 2.0)
